## Conversation that answers the provided questions:
**User:**
Hey, I've heard about the Ethereum Bridge, but I'm not entirely sure what it is or how to use it. Can you help me out?

**AI Assistant:**
The Ethereum Bridge is a testnet bridge that enables cross-chain conversions and transactions between the Verus network and Ethereum's Goerli testnet. You can access the bridge at https://ethtest.verus.services and use your Metamask to convert or send cross-chain to the Verus network from Ethereum's Goerli.

**User:**
That sounds interesting. What do I need to use the Ethereum Bridge?

**AI Assistant:**
To use the Ethereum Bridge, you will need to get some Goerli Ethereum, either from a faucet or via the Verus testnet liquidity baskets on Verus. Do you have any Goerli Ethereum already?

**User:**
I think I can get some. But before I try out the bridge, I wanted to ask about the bug bounty program I've heard about. What's the purpose of that?

**AI Assistant:**
The bug bounty program is aimed at encouraging the community to test the DeFi, ID, and PBaaS cross-chain protocols on the testnet and report any potential issues or bugs before the mainnet release. The Verus Coin Foundation is offering a bounty of at least 500 VRSC for the first 10 people who report actual protocol bugs, and a higher bounty for security-related reports.

**User:**
That sounds like a great idea. What kind of issues is the bug bounty program looking for?

**AI Assistant:**
The bug bounty program is looking for any actual protocol bugs, meaning failures of properly executed commands or APIs on a functioning VRSCTEST or PBaaS chain to function as intended. The program is also looking for potential security holes or exploitable issues in any part of the protocol. So, if you find any issues, be sure to report them and you might even earn a bounty!
What is the Ethereum Bridge, and how can I access it?

The Ethereum Bridge is a testnet bridge that enables cross-chain conversions and transactions between the Verus network and Ethereum's Goerli testnet. You can access the bridge at https://ethtest.verus.services and use your Metamask to convert or send cross-chain to the Verus network from Ethereum's Goerli.

## Ethereum Bridge
Although its deployment has been delayed, we expect the Ethereum bridge to be brought back up on the new Verus testnet within the next day or two. When it is up, you can access the Verus <-> Ethereum testnet bridge here: https://ethtest.verus.services, and use your metamask to convert or send cross-chain to the Verus network from Ethereum's Goerli. To use these features you will need to get some Goerli Ethereum, either from a faucet or via the Verus testnet liquidity baskets on Verus.The rest of these release notes are the same as the prior release. We encourage you to drop by the #pbaas-development channel, help the community prepare for mainnet release in the next couple weeks and start building your vision today!## Verus PBaaS and DeFi RC5 - BUG BOUNTIES
At this time, we are not aware of any bugs or errors in the DeFi, ID, or PBaaS cross chain protocols on this version of testnet. We do not anticipate any changes to the PBaaS protocol before mainnet release, and we hope you will join us on testnet trying out all of the incredible capabilities and looking for any potential, remaining issues that can possibly be found before mainnet release. While we don’t expect it to be easy to find bugs in the protocol, The Verus Coin Foundation is offering a bounty of at least 500 VRSC (possibly more for security related reports) for the first 10 people (7 still unclaimed) who are first to report any actual protocol bug before mainnet release, meaning failure of a properly executed command or API on a functioning VRSCTEST or PBaaS chain to function as intended. If anyone is first to find and describe the exploit for an exploitable security hole in any part of the protocol, the bounty will be a minimum of 1,000 VRSC, and for a serious potential security issue, 10,000 $VRSC.
